summary: An FBI National Threat Operations Center (NTOC) incident report summarizing an anonymous tip alleging potential sex and drug trafficking by Greg Horvath and Jana Jaffe, owners of Villa Arabesque in Acapulco, Mexico. The tipster connects the property and its owners to Jeffrey Epstein's associates and describes witnessing concerning activities involving underage girls and drugs in the early 2000s. The report was closed as 'Information Only' in October 2021.

persons.name: Greg Horvath
persons.context: Co-owner of Villa Arabesque in Acapulco, MX, and resident of Olympic Tower in New York. Anonymous tipster alleges he was involved in drug and/or sex trafficking in the early 2000s and partnered with a Palladium club owner.

persons.name: Jana Jaffe
persons.context: Co-owner of Villa Arabesque in Acapulco, MX, and resident of Olympic Tower in New York. Anonymous tipster alleges she was involved in drug and/or sex trafficking in the early 2000s.

persons.name: Doug Jaffe III
persons.context: Nephew of Jana Jaffe who invited the anonymous tipster to Villa Arabesque for spring break. He allegedly lied about the identity of an underage girl at the villa and was present during drug use.

persons.name: Jordan Jaffe
persons.context: Brother of Doug Jaffe III. His girlfriend, Tori LNU, warned the anonymous tipster about the activities at Villa Arabesque.

persons.name: Tori LNU
persons.context: Girlfriend of Jordan Jaffe who warned the anonymous tipster to be careful at Villa Arabesque, mentioning code words and the slogan 'Sun, Sex, and Spaghetti'.

persons.name: Henry Kissinger
persons.context: Named by the anonymous tipster as one of the high-profile individuals with ties to Epstein who stayed at Villa Arabesque.

persons.name: ANON
persons.context: Anonymous caller who reported potential sex trafficking by Greg Horvath and Jana Jaffe. Describes a spring break trip to Villa Arabesque in the early 2000s where she witnessed an underage girl, large amounts of cocaine, and a disturbing show at the Palladium club. She believes her drink was spiked.

connections.description: Co-owners of Villa Arabesque in Acapulco and alleged partners in potential trafficking activities.
Doug Jaffe III is identified as Jana Jaffe's nephew.
Tori LNU is identified as Jordan Jaffe's girlfriend.
Anonymous tipster alleges Horvath and Jaffe were partners with the owner of the Palladium club in Acapulco.
Anonymous tipster claims Villa Arabesque was used to house Henry Kissinger and other high-profile individuals with ties to Epstein.
College friends; Doug invited ANON to Villa Arabesque for spring break.

events.title: Spring break at Villa Arabesque
events.description: Anonymous tipster visits Villa Arabesque in Acapulco during spring break after an invitation from Doug Jaffe III. She observes armed guards, an inappropriately dressed 11-12 year old girl, and large amounts of cocaine being brought in.

events.title: Visit to Palladium club
events.description: Doug Jaffe III takes ANON and others to the Palladium club in Acapulco to see the '666 Dance with the Devil' show. The show allegedly involved underage girls being groped, having bras removed, and being bent over to show their buttocks to the audience.

events.title: ANON's suspected drugging
events.description: During a subsequent visit to Palladium, ANON feels incapacitated after drinking, suspects she was drugged, and is driven back to Villa Arabesque by the club owner. She is carried inside by Doug Jaffe III and wakes up the next day unsure of what happened.

events.title: Anonymous tip to FBI NTOC
events.description: An anonymous individual calls the FBI National Threat Operations Center to report potential sex trafficking by Greg Horvath and Jana Jaffe, connecting them to Epstein associates.

events.title: Incident report closed
events.description: The FBI incident report regarding potential sex trafficking by Greg Horvath and Jana Jaffe is closed as 'Information Only'.

locations: 1000 Custer Hollow Road, Clarksburg, WV 26306 (FBI NTOC address)
keyFacts: An anonymous tipster alleged Greg Horvath and Jana Jaffe, owners of Villa Arabesque in Acapulco, were involved in drug and/or sex trafficking in the early 2000s and housed high-profile individuals with ties to Jeffrey Epstein.

The tipster described witnessing an approximately 11-12 year old girl dressed scandalously at the villa and a disturbing show at the Palladium club where underage girls were allegedly groped on stage.
The tipster reported seeing large amounts of cocaine at the villa and later suspected she was drugged at the Palladium club before being driven back to the villa.
FBI database queries for Greg Horvath, Jana Jaffe, and Doug Jaffe revealed numerous results in case files, but none specifically concerned human trafficking.
The FBI incident report was generated from the tip in July 2020 and was closed as 'Information Only' in October 2021, with the information associated with a pending investigation (50D-NY-3027571).
